description: From French vocable or Latin vocābulum, from Latin vocō (“I call”).

entries.meaning: (linguistics) A word or utterance, especially with reference to its form rather than its meaning.
(music) A syllable or sound without specific meaning, used together with or in place of actual words in a song.
examples: Many Native American songs employ vocables, syllables that do not have referential meaning. These may be used to frame words or may be inserted among them; in some cases, they constitute the entire song text.
